data.title: Small coffee shop with tasty lunches
data.text: Tasty and healthy food.  Chicken cranberry goat cheese salad and iced tea hit the spot. Good location across from the visitors center.

data.title: Convenient to the Adams National Historic Park office
data.text: Hard to communicate with person taking order.  Sandwiches were good, served quickly. Coffee/ sandwich shop. Signage left a little to be desired.  Bathrooms were difficult to access.  One needed a key and to go out back into a hall reminiscent of an old school and down the hall.

data.title: Good fast bites
data.text: A large group of us ended up having a quick lunch here while leaving the Adams National Park Visitor Center. Food was very good for basic sandwiches and soups and salads. Service was really fast. Place was very clean. Ambience and seating sort of like a larger Subway Shop.

data.title: Good for a light lunch or snack
data.text: Close to the Adams historic tour center, near the T, good iced tea and panini. Service is average. Need a key for the restrooms.

data.title: Good sandwiches and quick service
data.text: The sandwiches were awesome. I highly recommend the turkey Brie. They are large enough to share. The service is quick. The atmosphere is "ok" which is why rated a 4 instead of a 5

data.title: Business Lunch hotspot
data.text: Right in the heart of the business district.  Very busy lunch place.  My wife had a salmon salad.  Fabulous.  I had a roast beef beef sandwich and salad.  Salad served with bagle bread toasted with garlic.  Very reasonable, lots of people in and out.

data.title: Surprisingly good menu and great prices
data.text: This small restaurant is located within a block of the Quincy T station and the Adams Historical Site.  Casual dining - bagels, soup, wraps, sandwiches, panini.  I had the Chicken and roasted red pepper panini  which took two meals to finish for about 7 dollars.  Nice place to hang out and the food was very good.

data.title: Nice Sandwich Shop For Lunch
data.text: Found this place as we walked down the street from the United Parish church. This place has a strong breakfast/bagel place but had a nice variety of other sandwhiches, soups, salads as well as desserts. This is a counter service place with small tables on one side and sofas on the other. Lunch for two ran $24 including sandwhich, drink, and chips. I had the roast beef with horseradish mayo on multigrain bread which was very tasty and sufficient. My wife enjoyed her panini. Service was very friendly.

data.title: Nice bistro across from adams visitor center
data.text:
Went for lunch as it 
was across from the Adams visitors center. Was looking for a local restaurant and I found it. They have a wide selection of sandwiches, panini's, salads and some baked goods. 

The food was very good and was full of locals. It is a relaxed place that you could just hang for coffee. I recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Jalapeño cream cheese
data.text: The Japanese cream cheese was a delight. Outside of that it was your run of the mill bagel joint. It was a good stop before you tour Peacefield.

data.title: Great sandwich shop right next to the T station in Quincy Center
data.text: I love walking here for a morning bagel and smoothie or afternoon sandwich.  Good fresh food at reasonable prices and very conveniently located by the T station.  There's not a lot of seating, but as long as you're not part of a big group, I've always been able to find a spot.  I love that they have a few outdoor tables on the sidewalk when the weather is nice.

data.title: the bagels are the best
data.text: Nice variety of bagels, and service is usually very good.  We go mostly for breakfast sandwiches, but they have a menu for lunch sandwiches, salads, soups and desserts that look good (but haven't tried them yet).

data.title: Come Hungry!
data.text: A huge selection of soups, salads and sandwiches...freshly and imaginatively prepared. It was too crowded at lunch time, so we returned after 1300 and had a great lunch. If you cannot find something you like in this place you are a very picky eater.

data.title: Perfect spot for Adams!
data.text: We visited Quincy for the Adams National Historical Park. Before the tour, we lunched at GT. The egg and cheese croissant sandwich was delicious. We visited again after the tour for iced tea and a blueberry muffin. The food and service were very good. Great convenience too if you're going to learn about the Adams family.

data.title: Good food good price
data.text: Right across from John Adams visitor center, we stopped in for a quick bite before our tour. Great menu, a lot of choices, chicken chipotle tasted good.

data.title: Good location
data.text: Located right across the street from the Adams Visitor Center. Busy deli with good choices of soup, salads, and sandwiches. Could have used more tables.

data.title: Much better service upfront at cashier. Girl greeted me with good morning and a smile.
data.text: Glad I went there this am! Much better service on the cash register. Friendly girl. I had stopped going there for months due to the fact that staff were rude well one staff member. Pity. But the breakfast bagels are so tasty.  I hope this girl stays and it does make a difference .

data.title: Don't bother. Desserts look better than they are.
data.text:
Little cafe with good looking menu, but food was disappointingly so-so. Veggie panini was greasy. Shrimp salad only had three shrimp on it. 

Desserts looked yummy but were blah, laking distinctive taste or texture. I saw them behind the counter in boxes that looked like frozen desserts from Sams Club.

data.title: Tiny , but good
data.text: Stopped here while visiting the Adams Historical Park headquartered across the street. Mainly filled with students ordering bagels, my daughter and I had great salads there , my husband enjoyed clam chowder and a sandwich. There is limited seating, but it seemed many of the orders were to go. For a quick, good lunch, I would recommend it. It does not have a gluten free menu (our daughter requires this), but she was able to find a healthy filling salad. Efficient service

data.title: Great flavored coffee and bagels!
data.text: Really great coffee flavors and iced coffee flavors.  The bagel I had was also amazing.  The baked goods looked delicious but I did not order any.  There are plenty of table of all shapes and sizes depending on whether you are alone or with a crowd.  There are also some comfortable chairs and Wi-Fi.
